Sentencas: Scaling analysis of nonOhmic electrical transport in double perovskite (DP) compounds like La2NiMnO6 and Sr(2)Fea(3)Mn(0.7)MoO(6) is presented over a wide range of electric bias and temperatures.
Titulo: Characterization of nonOhmic electrical transport in double perovskite compounds through bias scale and nonlinearity exponent

Sentencas: It is shown that the voltage V-0(T) at which conductance deviates from its Ohmic value Sigma(0)(T) scales with Sigma(0)(T) as Vo(T) similar to Sigma(0)(T)(xT), x(T).
Titulo: Characterization of nonOhmic electrical transport in double perovskite compounds through bias scale and nonlinearity exponent

Sentencas: being the onset exponent characterizing the onset of nonOhmic conduction.
Titulo: Characterization of nonOhmic electrical transport in double perovskite compounds through bias scale and nonlinearity exponent

Sentencas: Interestingly, it was found that x(T) is negative and insensitive to the nature of conduction mechanism in DPs but is related to the characteristic temperature T-0 and the mean hopping length H-m.
Titulo: Characterization of nonOhmic electrical transport in double perovskite compounds through bias scale and nonlinearity exponent

Sentencas: We provide a scaling formalism in terms of the parameters V-0(T) and x(T) in DPs for deeper understanding of the spintronic application and the electrode functioning in solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC).
Titulo: Characterization of nonOhmic electrical transport in double perovskite compounds through bias scale and nonlinearity exponent

Sentencas: Inelastic multi-step tunneling is found to be the suitable mechanism of electronic transport characterized completely by these two parameters.
Titulo: Characterization of nonOhmic electrical transport in double perovskite compounds through bias scale and nonlinearity exponent
